snippet: President Park Geun-hye’s conciliatory overtures Thursday came amid signs that South and North Korea were moving toward a thaw after months of tensions.
abstract: South Korean Pres Park Geun-hye says that South and North Korea should resume arranging reunions of families separated by the Korean War six decades ago; renews a proposal to build peace park straddling their heavily armed border.
lead_paragraph: President Park Geun-hye’s conciliatory overtures Thursday came amid signs that South and North Korea were moving toward a thaw after months of tensions.

headline.main: South Korea Proposes Talks to Reunite Families Divided by War
headline.print_headline: South Korea Proposes Talks to Reunite War-Divided Families
